Package main.controllers

Class InputController

java.lang.Object
main.controllers.Controller
main.controllers.InputController
public class InputController extends Controller
This class takes inputs from the user when the main application requires so. There are different methods for different variable types.
Since:
2022-11-08
Version:
1.0
Author:
Tai Chen An

  • Constructor Details

    • InputController

      public InputController()

  • Method Details

    • getInt

      public static int getInt(int start, int end, String message)
      Prints the given message and takes an integer input from the user. Input must be between(inclusive) the given start and end fields. Continues to prompt the user for a input if previous input is invaid.
      Parameters:
      start - smallest valid integer input.
      end - largest valid integer input
      message - message to display to user.
      Returns:
      int input from user.

    • getString

      public static String getString(String message)
      Prints the given message and takes a string input from the user.
      Parameters:
      message - message to display to user.
      Returns:
      String input from user

    • getNumericString

      public static String getNumericString(String message, int lo, int hi)
      Prints the given message and takes a numeric string input from the user. Length of input must be between(inclusive) the given lo and hi fields. Continues to prompt the user for a input if previous input is invaid.
      Parameters:
      message - message to display to user.
      lo - shortest valid length of string.
      hi - longest valid length of string.
      Returns:
      numeric string input from user.

    • getBoolean

      public static boolean getBoolean(String message, char T, char F)
      Prints the given message and takes a character input from the user. Input must be either of T or F. Continues to prompt the user for a input if previous input is invaid.
      Parameters:
      message - message to display to user.
      T - character representing the true value.
      F - character representing the false value.
      Returns:
      user input as a boolean value.

    • getDouble

      public static double getDouble(String message)
      Prints the given message and takes a double input from the user. Continues to prompt the user for a input if previous input is not a double.
      Parameters:
      message - message to display to user.
      Returns:
      double input from user.

    • confirmIdentity

      public static boolean confirmIdentity(MovieGoer movieGoer)
      Takes inputs for name and mobile number from the user. Verifies the input with the given movieGoer. Continues to prompt the user for inputs if previous input is invalid.
      Parameters:
      movieGoer - movie-goer to verify identity.
      Returns:
      true if user input matches the given movieGoer details.
